head.supplied: Melbourne, ¶ 10/5/83. ¶ Mons. E. A. Pesoli, ¶ Acting Consul General for France &c ¶ ¶ I find, dear Consul Pesoli, some difficulty of selecting seeds for the Agronomic Institut of Tipaza, ¶ because s...

div.p: Carton no. 17, Melbourne, consulat, Serie A, Centre des Archives Diplomatiques, Nantes..
For a printed version of this letter see Home & Maroske (1997), p. 13. Melbourne,

I find, dear Consul Pesoli, some difficulty of selecting seeds for the Agronomic Institut of Tipaza,
Tipaza (or Tipasa) is located on the Algerian coast, west of Algiers. because since the last 25 years and even more I have made so many sendings of seeds to Algeria, that all our ordinary trees and shrubs have become common there. It seems to me best, to ask Mr. de Noter first for some further explanation of his requirements; if he will specify , what he particularly stands in need of, I will act on any suggestions of his as far as is within my means; but it seems to me unadvisable to send anything from here, that did not add to the Australian plants in Algier, as he could of numerous species obtain now locally the seeds.
Ready to render you any services at any time, I remain your regardful friend

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have latterly not been well, which accounts for the tardiness of my reply.
